I've been playing this game for over 2 years, and all I can say is it can either be really fun or make you want to rip your hair out. Its a more fun experience when playing with friends that's for sure, but as someone who solo queues 99% of the time it can be good on its own. I always end up coming back to this game, and maybe I am addicted to it, but its unique and there's no other game like it. Even tho this game is classified a horror, its anything but one lol. Only very few instances where I get jumpscared these days. Its a big meme

Super fun! Play as a killer or a survivor and try to escape. My only complaint would be that a lot of killers tend to camp their victims which takes away from the fun of the game. And the developers consider a strategy tactic so they will not be implementing any consequences other than fewer points received to the killer at the end. But when you get a good lobby it's an awesome experience.

DBD is a fun, if flawed, game. It took my friends a while of prodding me and dragging me along to actually get into it, and I wanted to share why it took so long to hopefully prevent new players from burning out too fast. 

The thing that took me a while to understand as a competitive gamer is that "winning" in DBD is unlike winning in most multiplayer PvP games. Instead of needing to survive or get all 4 survivors out, or kill all 4 survivors as killer, there isn't really a clear-cut "win". Instead, you need to adjust to the fact that, as survivor, sometimes you'll die, and it's fine as long as you accomplish enough during your games. Run the killer around while your teammates pump out generators, or be altruistic and help your teammates by healing and unhooking them to rack up enough points to be considered a "win" even though you perished at the hands of a crazy lady in a pig mask. Likewise, as killer, you really only have to kill one or two survivors for it to be considered a win in your book. With that, unless you really mess up elsewhere, you should end up earning more points than most of the lobby's survivors, even those that escape, so don't beat yourself up if you don't kill all 4.

That being said, once you unlearn the black-and-white concept of winning and losing that other PvP games stick to, this is a fun game, even a relaxing PvP experience compared to other white-knuckle competitive games. It can be a fun co-op experience with some pals, and an equally great solo experience as a killer. Obviously there are bugs, and the occasional toxic asshole, but on the whole it's a very solid game, certainly worth $20.

Игра хороша, не буду расписывать плюсы так как смысла мало, а вот главный минус стоило бы выделить.
Кхем кхем, так вот матчмейкинг просто отвратителен! (особенно на убийце) Вы можете только начать играть в эту игру и против вас может спокойно попасться тима из высоких рангов (1-4) с одни челобесом 10+ ранга которого они взяли вагончиком и будут катать вас как хлебушек с сыром в микроволновке (и такое может идти и по пять каток подряд)
Я всё же не прошу против себя нубов и т.д. Но хочется всё же сурвов примерно своего уровня с которыми можно нормально играть, а не уходить в тильт из-за такого говнеца.
Так что если вы вдруг любитель поапать ранги, то эту игру я бы всё же не рекомендовал, так как нормалов нет и придётся на каждом новом персе учиться играть против высокоранговых чуваков (особенно отражено на тех же убийцах). Помолимся же на нормальный матчмейкинг
UPD: Ах да, ещё в этой игре огромнейшее количество токсиков. И по этому поводу могу дать только один совет - не читайте чат и просто игнорьте всех и вся и играйте как вам заблагорассудится :3

The grind is endless and for some reason I cant get enough of just letting this game beat my brains in. Steep learning curve. Lots of DLC to purchase is a bit of a bummer along with the perk grind. People who have been playing for awhile will have an advantage over you for quite some time. I say it could take at least a 100 or so hours before you start to understand builds and how to play around them. Nevertheless don't  be surprised running into one of the many salty killers/survivors. It goes both ways, so best of luck! You are gonna need it if you want to solo. Playing with the friends makes it alot easier

After playing this game for almost 460 hours, I think I can finally PROPERLY give it a fair review.

This game is an asymmetrical 1v4 game. 1 Killer, 4 Survivors. This game can be either really fun or extremely aggravating. Lemme start with a quote from one of the games most popular content creators, Otzdarva.

"There will always be someone with a higher skill level than you, do not take loses in this game to heart."

This quote can not be more appropriate.

This game has a HUGE skill curve to get around, I have played for 400+ hours and STILL find myself making huge mistakes when it comes to getting away from the killer or catching the survivor. 
With this game, you have to be willing to put the time in and practice, watch guides and learn to be good at it. It's not a pick up and play kind of game, it's meant more so as a competitive experience. If that isn't your kind of game, stop reading right here and take this as a "Do not buy." Don't get lured in by the Cross-over DLC's. Unless you and 4 other peeps are picking this up for a night of good times, ignore it. It will be a waste to you.

Now if you do have the competitive mindset, you're going to have to spend the time to practice and learn certain strats based on what side you choose to main. Otzdarva has amazing guides and tierlists, so if you decide to pick up the game after reading this review, go to his channel and start learning.

For me, it's a good pick up and I do recommend it. Just don't let the game get to you and ignore the bad apples.
See you in the fog.
